column2: Indikator BHS
column3: Indicator English

column2: U „krugu“ na Bulevaru, gdje je sto za stoni tenis, postoji rasvjeta pa se tu ne skupljaju narkomani
column3: In Bulevar’s 'circle', where the ping pong table is located, drug users do not gather, because it’s well lit.

column2: Postoji povjerenik MZ Cernica
column3: The Mjesna zajednica of Cernica has a commissioner.

column2: Mladi sa zapadne strane se ne dogovaraju preko društvenih mreža gdje će ići da se biju
column3: The youth from the West side of Mostar do not plan through social media platforms where they should go to fight.

column2: U „krugu“ na Bulevaru postoji rasvjeta
column3: Bulevar’s 'circle' is illuminated.

column2: Prostorije MZ Cernica nisu uvijek zaključane
column3: The premises of the Mjesna zajednica of Cernica aren’t always locked.

column2: Na Bulevaru nema narkomana
column3: There aren’t any drug users in Bulevar.

column2: Stare ruševine u kojima se se prije okupljali narkomani i dileri su srušene/poravnate
column3: The old ruins where drug users and dealers used to gather have been demolished / leveled

column2: Policija daje novčane kazne od 400 KM na licu mjesta za narušavanje javnog reda i mira, kao i u Sarajevu
column3: The ruined buildings are destroyed, where previously drug users and dealers gathered.

column2: Roditelje nije strah da će osobe iz komšiluka njihovu djecu uvući u svijet droge
column3: Parents are not scared of the fact that some people from their neighborhood could drag their children into the world of narcotics.

column2: Kad je kućni red (14:00-17:00 h) niko se ne dere, pa ljudi mogu spavati
column3: During quiet hours (2 to 5 pm) no one yells, therefore people can sleep.

column2: Djeca sa Bulevara mogu da koriste igralište za fudbal, koje su sami uređivali.
column3: Children who live in Bulevar can use the football/soccer field that they themselves made.

column2: Momka od 15-16 godina, koji oko 11-12 sati navečer šeta psa, na Bulevaru preko puta Doma zdravlja ne čeka grupa navijača Zrinjskog da ga prebiju
column3: There are no Zrinjski fans waiting to beat up a 15 or 16 year old boy who was walking his dog in the evening along Bulevar across from the hospital at 11 or 12 in the evening.

column2: Ljudi s Bulevara i Cernice mogu ići u najbližu ambulantu - Dom zdravlja na Bulevaru, a ne na Carinu.
column3: People from Bulevar and Cernica can go to the nearest clinic on Bulevar and not the one in Carina.

column2: Ljudi ne bacaju otpad u Neretvu
column3: People don’t throw trash into the Neretva river.

column2: Komšija, vlasnik psa, ne dozvoli da njegov pas nekoga ujede dok ga drži na povocu
column3: The neighbour who owns a dog doesn’t allow his dog to bite someone while leashed.

column2: Djeca od 17-18 godina sa zapadne strane ne ustaju ujutro u 7-8 sati svakog februara, kako bi na Partizanskom groblju kamenovali starije ljude iz udruženja antifašista s istočne strane, koji dolaze da obilježe oslobođenje Mostara
column3: Children aged 17-18 from the west side do not get up at 7-8 in the morning every February to stone older people from the anti-fascist association from the east, who come to mark the liberation of Mostar, at the Partisan Cemetery.

column2: Prolaznici u Cernici nisu primorani sklanjati svoju djecu ispred jurećih automobila
column3: The passengers in Cernica are not forced to move their children to get away from the speeding cars.

column2: Igralište, kao glavna atrakcija na Bulevaru, nije uništeno
column3: The playground, which is seen as the main attraction on Bulevar, isn't ruined.

column2: Dječak ne mora da čeka da naiđe neko od komšija, kako bi se s njim/njom vratio kući iz parka na Bulevaru kad padne mrak.
column3: A boy does not have to wait until some neighbor passes by to return with him home when night falls, .

column2: Policija se ne grije na pumpi prekoputa cijelu noćnu smjenu, nego boravi po Bulevaru i Cernici
column3: The police do not warm themselves at the gas station during the whole night shift, but stay on Bulevar and Cernica

column2: Po ulicama nema grafita s ustaškim znakovima
column3: There aren’t any graffiti with Ustasha signs on the streets.

column2: Ljudi se više ne parkiraju nepropisno u Cernici, jer su primijetili da policija tu često stoji
column3: People no longer park improperly in Cernica, as they have noticed that the police often stand there

column2: U školi se dijete ne klasifikuje po tome kakvu uslugu njegov/njen roditelj može učiniti nastavniku
column3: At school, a child is not classified according to what kind of service his / her parent can do for the teacher

column2: Bulevar i Cernica su navečer jednako mirni i ljeti i zimi
column3: Bulevar and Cernica are equally calm in the evening in summer and winter

column2: U naselju Bulevar su postavljeni ležeći policajci, pa vozači obraćaju pažnju na malu djecu koja tuda prolaze.
column3: Speedbumps have been set up in the Bulevar neighborhood, so drivers pay attention to small children crossing.

column2: Na prometnoj magistrali na Bulevaru, ljudi ne moraju hodati cestom, jer se na trotoaru ne nalazi ograda oko ruševina
column3: On the main road in Bulevar, people don’t walk down the road, because there are no fences around the ruins near the sidewalk.

column2: Ljudi ne parkiraju auta ispred ulaza u zgrade na Bulevaru
column3: People don’t park their cars near the entrance's to buildings in Bulevar.

column2: Političari su imenovali komesara policije HNK
column3: Politicians choose the commissioner of the police in Herzegovina-Neretva Canton.

column2: Prestupnici se sankcionišu krivično.
column3: Criminals are being punished.

column2: Muzika iz „Sky Bar“ nije preglasna ljeti, pa ljudi nemaju osjećaj kao da kod njih u stanu svira
column3: The music from "Sky Bar" is not so loud during summer that people have the feeling that it is playing in their own apartments.

column2: Zaštitar ispred Gradske uprave reaguje kad vidi da se dešava bitka
column3: The security guard in front of the City Administration reacts when he sees that a fight is happening

column2: Policija javno objavljuje imena , prezimena, ime oca i majke, svih osoba koje su učestvovale u nekom incidentu.
column3: The police publicly announce the names, surnames, names of father and mother, all persons who participated in an incident.

column2: Roditelji ne uče djecu da su vjerske razlike prepreka za druženje.
column3: Parents do not teach children that religious differences are a barrier to friendship.

column2: Na igralištu na Bulevaru osoba koja ima apartmane nije napravila parking na javnoj površini
column3: The owner of apartment does not make a parking lot out of a public play area in Bulevar.

column2: Ljudi se ne boje da će ih neko napasti kada prođu pored rampe na Bulevaru u 22:00, jer je osvijetljeno
column3: People are not afraid that someone will attack them when they pass by the ramp on the Bulevar at 22:00, because it is illuminated.

column2: Stare ruševine u kojima se okupljaju narkomani i dileri su srušene/poravnate
column3: Old ruins where the drug users and dealers were gathering before are torn down.

column2: Školovani ljudi su postavljeni na vlast
column3: Educated people are appointed to power

column2: Ultrasi ne dolaze u dvorišta Bulevara da kamenuju automobile
column3: “Ultrasi” (Football fans) don’t come into Bulevar's green spaces to throw rocks at cars.

column2: Mladi na Bulevaru i Cernici nisu navikli na to da će petkom ili subotom naveče dolaziti navijači sa zapadne strane da prave incidente
column3: Young people on Bulevar and Cernica are not used to fans from the west coming on Friday or Saturday nights to make incidents

column2: Kontejner za smeće nije uvijek pun
column3: The trash container isn’t always full.

column2: U slučaju nekog incidenta, policija pronalazi počinitelje preko nadzornih kamera
column3: In the event of an incident, police find the perpetrators through surveillance cameras

column2: Policija ne pušta maloljetnike koji prave nerede na slobodu bez sankcija
column3: Police do not release minors who commit riots without sanctions

column2: U školama se djecu ne uči šta su po nacionalnosti, nego da su sva djeca/ljudi jednaki
column3: Schools do not teach children what their nationality is, but that all children / people are equal

column2: Naselje je bezbjedno jer nema narkomana u krugu/parku kod MZ
column3: The settlement is safe because there are no drug users in the circle park near the Mjesna Zajednica.

column2: Odgovorni (policija, sudstvo, tužilaštvo) sankcionišu politiku šovinizma
column3: Those responsible (police, judiciary, prosecution) sanction chauvinist policies.

column2: Policija sankcioniše roditelje maloljetnika koji prave navijačke grafite u gradu
column3: The police sanction the parents of minors who make football fan graffiti in the city.

column2: Policija izađe na teren kada dobije poziv građana
column3: The police come to the place where trouble is caused when the citizens call them.

column2: U Cernici nema potrebe za policijskim racijama, jer nema droge
column3: There is no need for police raids in Cernica, because there aren’t any drugs.

column2: Pogrešna naručena pjesma ne dovodi do bitke u kafiću između mladih muškaraca sa istočne i zapadne strane grada
column3: A fight between young men from the East and West side isn’t caused by a song which was accidentally asked to play in a bar.

column2: U kafiću alkohol ne dovodi do tuče
column3: Alcohol does not lead to a fight in a cafe

column2: Roditelji djeci ne usađuju sjeme mržnje kroz zabranu da se druže s djecom druge nacije (problematična, bolesna, siromašna)
column3: Parents do not instill hatred in their children by banning them from associating with children of other nations (problematic, sick, poor)

column2: Niko ne nagovara djecu od 17-18 godina sa zapadne strane da svakog februara na Partizanskom kamenuju ljude s istočne strane, koji dolaze da obilježe oslobođenje Mostara
column3: No one persuades 17 or 18 year-olds from the West side to go to the Partisan cemetery and throw rocks at people from the East side, who come to mark the liberation of Mostar.

column2: Navijački grafiti ne koriste simbole mržnje, kao što su kukasti križevi
column3: Fan-made grafitti does not use hate symbols, like for example swastikas.

column2: Prostorije MZ Cernica su na istom mjestu gdje su i prije bile
column3: The premises of the Mjesna zajednica of Cernica is the same place as they were before.

column2: Djeca i mladi s Bulevara i iz Cernice su sami skupljali novac da kupe zemlju za igralište
column3: Children and the youth from Bulevar and Cernica raised money by themselves to buy soil to build a playground.

column2: Djeca na Bulevaru su organizovala turnir
column3: A (football) tournament was organized by the children from Bulevar.

column2: Park na Bulevaru nije „podjetinjio“, jer ne privlači samo djecu do 10 godina
column3: The park in Bulevar isn’t equipped just for children 10 years and younger.

column2: Vlasnici pasa u Cernici čiste nakon što njihovi ljubimci izvrše nuždu
column3: When dogs relieve themselves in Cernica, their owners clean it up immediately.

column2: U Mostaru ima dovoljno kamera, pogotovo na zabačenim mračnim mjestima
column3: There are enough surveillance cameras in Mostar, especially in the dark, isolated areas.

column2: Ljudi ne parkiraju auta ispred vrata u Cernici tako da ne blokiraju ulaz u prodavnice (kuće, frizerski salon)
column3: People don’t park their cars in front of a building entrance in Cernica, blocking the entrance to shops (homes, hair salon).

column2: Političari su riješili problem manjka policajaca u HNK
column3: Politicians have solved the problem of the lack of police officers in HNK

column2: Nasilnici se sankcionišu novčano.
column3: Bullies are sanctioned with fines.

column2: Ljudi se ne suoče sa 100 problema, kada treba da izvade 1 papir
column3: People do not face 100 problems when they need to get 1 piece of paper

column2: Auta se ne parkiraju kod „Korza“ pa druga auta mogu tuda proći
column3: Cars aren’t parked near Korzo and others can easily pass.

column2: Učitelji reaguju kada se djeca rugaju drugoj djeci
column3: Teachers react when some children make fun of others.

column2: U Mostaru postoji konkretan plan za suzbijanje huliganizma, jer je postavljen komesar policije
column3: There is a concrete plan in Mostar to suppress hooliganism, because a police commissioner has been appointed.

column2: U naselju Bulevar se ne preprodaje droga
column3: In Bulevar nobody is reselling narcotics.

column2: Niko ne napada na imovinu osoba koje rade u MUP-u na poslovima hvatanja dilera
column3: Nobody is invading a person’s property while the police is trying to catch the drug dealers.

column2: Policija češće prolazi automobilom kroz Bulevar i Cernicu
column3: A police car passes more often through Bulevar and Cernica.

column2: Komšije reaguju ako čuju da se pljačka stan u njihovoj zgradi
column3: The neighbors react if they see that someone’s apartment in their building is being robbed.

column2: Navijači Zrinjskog ne dolaze na Bulevar, pa djeca ne razmišljaju kako će najbrže pobjeći iz parka u Cernicu
column3: Zrinjski fans don’t come to Bulevar, so the children don't have to think how they can run the quickest out of the park in Cernica.

column2: Djeca i mladi s Bulevara i iz Cernice su pravili golove za teren
column3: Children and youth from Bulevar and Cernica make goals for a soccer field.

column2: Inicijativa, koju je pokrenula teta Inga, da se osvijetli igralište, je odobrena
column3: Miss Inga launched an initiative to illuminate the playground and it was approved.

column2: Ljudi nisu izolirani u 4 zida pa ne stvaraju predrasude o osobama koje ne poznaju
column3: People are not isolated within 4 walls so they don’t develop prejudices about others that they don’t know.

column2: Organizacija „Novi most“ je povezala mlade s Bulevara i iz Cernice, jer ih je vodila na Karting, na palačinke
column3: The association “Novi Most” had connected the young people from Bulevar and Cernica, because the association had taken them cart racing and to eat pancakes.

column2: Stanari imaju neometan miran san jer ispod prozora nema galame tokom noći
column3: The tenants have an uninterrupted, peaceful dreams because there is no yelling beneath their windows throughout the night.

column2: Na prometnoj magistrali na Bulevaru je postavljen radar.
column3: There is traffic radar on the main road in Bulevar.

column2: U prostorijama MZ postoji kancelarija za dežurnog policajca
column3: There is on duty police officer in front of the local community council’s (MZ) premises.

column2: U Cernici postoji policajac pozornik
column3: There is a patrol policeman in Cernica.

column2: Žena s bebom u kolicima može proći kroz prolaz pored „Rođenih“, jer tu nema parkiranih auta
column3: A woman with her baby in a stroller can pass through the passage next to "Rodenih" because there, there aren't any parked cars.

column2: Ne stvara se zastoj u dvosmjernoj ulici pored bivšeg suda u Cernici, jer ljudi ne parkiraju vozila sa strane
column3: There is no traffic jam in the two-way street next to the former court in Cernica, because people do not park vehicles on the side

column2: Djeca ne govore da ih boli glava ili da im se povraća kako ne bi išli u školu zbog nastavnikovog negativnog ophođenja
column3: Children are not acting that they have headaches or that they’re feeling sick so they couldn’t go to school because of their teacher’s negative behavior.

column2: U gradu se širi područje gdje žene mogu da same hodaju, jer se osjećaju sigurno.
column3: There is a broad area in the city where women can walk alone, because they feel safe.

column2: Prisustvo policajca u Šantićevoj nije znak da bi moglo doći do incidenta
column3: The presence of the police in “Šantićeva” street isn’t a sign that there could occur an incident.

column2: U Cernici (ulica Adema Buća) djeca slobodno šetaju bez straha od brzih vozila/saobraćaja
column3: In Cernica, in “Adema Buća” street, children take a walk freely without fear of the speeding cars/traffic.

column2: Za ženom koja rano ide na posao ne idu dvojica nepoznatih muškaraca brzim korakom
column3: Early in the morning, two unknown male figures are not quickly following a woman who’s going to work.

column2: Policija na terenu ostaje duže od 5 minuta
column3: The police stay longer than 5 minutes at the place where an accident happens.

column2: Niko nije vidio da su se dvije žene od 60 godina pobile.
column3: Nobody sees two 60 year-old women fighting.

column2: Svi stanari u MZ Cernica se osjećaju odgovornim za svoja djela
column3: All tenants that live in the MZ Cernica feel responsible for their action.

column2: Mlađi igraju lopte na igralištu na Bulevaru
column3: Youth play soccer on the playground in Bulevar.

column2: Djeca ne lupaju loptom u 14:00 kad ljudi spavaju
column3: Children do not make any noise with balls at 14:00 when people are sleeping.

column2: Očevi izvode malu djecu na Bulevar da se igraju
column3: In Bulevar, fathers take their children out to play.

column2: Na imaginarnim, nacionalističkim granicama Bulevara između dvije strane, katoličke i muslimanske, ne dešavaju se bitke između navijača Veleža i Zrinjskog, starosti od 16-25 godina
column3: On the imaginary and nationalistic border separating two sides, Catholic and Muslim, young Zrinjski and Velež fans between the ages of 16 and 25 do not start any fights.

column2: Navijači sa zapadne strane ne dolaze na igralište VI osnovne škole da prave incidente kad djeca igraju fudbal
column3: Fans from the West side do not come to the playground, which is a part of Primary School VI, to cause trouble while children are playing soccer.

column2: Djeca s Bulevara i iz Cernice su sredili igralište na Bulevaru
column3: Children from Bulevar and Cernica fixed the playground in Bulevar.

column2: Djeca i mladi s Bulevara i iz Cernice su čistili teren
column3: Children and youth from Bulevar and Cernica cleaned up the area.

column2: Čovjek, kojem lopta s igrališta doleti u dvorište, ne probuši loptu
column3: A man, in whose backyard a ball lands from the playground, does not deflate the ball.

column2: Mladi s Bulevara i iz Cernice koji su se povezali u „Novom mostu“ su nastavili da se dalje druže i na drugim mjestima (u parku)
column3: Young people from Bulevar and Cernica that met in “Novi Most” are still on good terms and hang out in other places (in the park)

column2: Ljudi rješavaju svoje male lokalne probleme i tako stvaraju mogućnost za rješavanje većih problema
column3: People solve their small local problems, thereby create an opportunity to solve their community’s larger problems.

column2: Roditelji mogu utjecati na djecu da ne ostaju dokasno vani
column3: Parents can teach their children not to stay out late.

column2: Roditelji djeci ne usađuju sjeme mržnje kroz zabranu da se druže s djecom druge nacije (koja su problematična, bolesna, problematična)
column3: Parents do not instill hatred in their children by banning them from associating with children of other nations (who are problematic, sick)

column2: Kod prolaza kod Suda u Cernici su stavljene kamere na kojoj se vidi registracija parkiranih auta pa im se naplaćuju kazne
column3: Surveillance cameras are put by the passsage near the courthouse in Cernica to see the parked cars’ registrations so the owners would have to pay a fine.

column2: U krugu oko stola za stoni tenis nema razbijenog stakla pa se djeca mogu bezbjedno igrati
column3: Children can play safely in the park where the table for table tennis is put, because there is no broken glass around it.

column2: Kontejner je pomjeren dalje od parka na Bulevaru, pa vjetar ne donosi smeće u park koji su djeca s Bulevara očistila
column3: The trash container is moved away from the park in Bulevar so the wind can’t bring any trash in the park which the children from Bulevar have cleaned.

column2: Igralište na Bulevaru nije ograđeno tankom žicom, koja se već nakon 7 dana uništi
column3: The playground in Bulevar isn’t fenced in with (thin) chiicken wire, which is destroyed 7 days after someone puts it there.

column2: Osobe idu na utakmice Veleža da navijaju, a ne da se biju
column3: People go to Velež football matches to cheer for them, not to fight.

column2: Mostar je postao turistički centar Hercegovine
column3: Mostar has become a tourist center in Herzegovina.

column2: Dječak se osjeća sigurno i po danu i po noći kada u komšiluku vidi ljude na ulici
column3: A boy feels safe during the day and at night when he sees people in on the street in his neighborhood.

column2: Kada vidi da je jedna grupa navijača vidno opremljena palicama, policija reaguje na vrijeme
column3: When they see that one group of fans is visibly equipped with batons, the police react on time

column2: Kada vidi da je jedna grupa navijača vidno opremljena palicama, policija raspoređuje veću grupu policajaca duž tih ulica
column3: When they see that one group of fans is visibly equipped with batons, the police deploy a larger group of police officers along those streets

column2: U Mostaru odgovorni (policija, sudstvo, tužilaštvo) sankcionišu svakoga ko krši javni red i mir
column3: Accountable people (police, judiciary, prosecution) punish the ones who violate public order and peace.

column2: Ne dešavaju se bitke na opasnim mjestima, kao Španski, Bulevar, Cernica
column3: Fights don't take place in dangerous areas, such as Spanish Square, Bulevar, Cernica.

column2: U cijelom naselju (Bulevar) postoje sigurnosne kamere
column3: There are surveillance cameras all over Bulevar.

column2: Ljudi, u slučaju potrebe, slobodno zovu policiju bez straha da će im neko zbog toga razbiti prozore
column3: When necessary, people call the police without worrying that someone may break their windows because of it.

column2: U kasnim satima nije neugodno proći od Bunura prema Cernici, jer ima ljudi.
column3: In late hours of the evening, it isn't uncomfortable to pass from the Bunur bridge towards Cernica because there are people present.

column2: Nacionalne stranke ne plaćaju da se prave incidenti pred izbore.
column3: National parties do not pay someone to cause trouble before the elections.

column2: Komšije ne posmatraju nijemo nasilje momka nad djevojkom u krugu kod stola za stoni tenis
column3: Neighbors do not observe the silent violence of a boy against a girl in the 'circle' at the ping pong table

column2: Policija i MUP ne štite niti jednog Ultrasa koji učestvuje u napadima
column3: The police and the Ministry of the Interior are not protecting any "Ultrasi" (Zrinski fans) who participate in attacks

column2: U sokacima u Cernici (Hadžiomerovića, Rudinčeva) blizu silaza na Neretvu nema sumnjivih osoba koje razmjenjuju i broje novac noću
column3: In the alleys in Cernica (Hadžiomerović, Rudinčeva) near the descent to the river Neretva, there are no suspicious persons who exchange and count money at night

column2: Roditelji edukuju djecu da droga ne valja
column3: Parents educate their children that drugs aren't good.

column2: Djevojka smije sama da hoda Bulevarom pored kruga u ponoć
column3: The girl is allowed to walk alone along Bulevar next to the circle at midnight

column2: U parku pored Marketa ima dosta djece
column3: There are a lot of children in the park near the market.

column2: U parku pored Marketa ima dosta starijih osoba
column3: There are many elderly people in the park near the market.

column2: Stariji dolaze da gledaju kako djeca i mladi igraju lopte na igralištu na Bulevaru
column3: The elderly come to watch children and youth play football at the playground in Bulevar.

column2: Navijači Zrinskog ne dolaze nakon utakmica na Bulevar ili u Šantićevu da prave incidente
column3: Zrinjski fans do not come to cause trouble after the match in Bulevar or on Šantićeva street.

column2: Navijači Zrinjskog, koji imaju 17-20 godina, ne dolaze preko stepenica u prolazu s magistrale u park na Bulevaru, da gađaju kamenjem
column3: Zrinjski fans between the ages of 17 to 20 do not come across the steps from the main road to the park in Bulevar to throw rocks.

column2: Mladi sa zapadne strane ne donose kukaste križeve na Partizansko kada ga posjećuju anti-fašisti
column3: Young people from the west do not bring swastikas to Partizansko when it is visited by anti-fascists

column2: U gradu ne postoji niko ko će kupiti sprej s namjerom da crta kukasti križ
column3: There is no one in the city that would intentionally buy spray paint in order to draw swastikas.

column2: U gradu ne postoji niko ko ima želju da nacrta kukasti križ na zidu neke zgrade
column3: There is no one in the city who wants to draw swastikas on a building wall.

column2: Navijači jednog fudbalskog kluba ne crtaju svoje navijačke grafite na drugoj strani grada
column3: Fans that support one football club don’t draw their club’s symbol on the other side of the city.

column2: Grupa, koja pravi navijački grafit „1981“ kod Publike, ne snima pjesmu koja vrijeđa drugu stranu
column3: A fan group that makes the “1981” graffiti near Publika, doesn’t sing a song that insults the other side.

column2: Ljudi koji žive u Cernici uče svoju djecu da ne bacaju smeće u Neretvu
column3: People who live in Cernica teach their children not to throw trash into the Neretva river.

column2: Mladi momak sa istočne strane ima prijatelje sa zapadne strane grada (npr. Vatikan)
column3: A young boy from the East side has friends from the West side (for example, Vatikan).

column2: Roditelji ne strahuju da će im sina neko izmlatiti u kafiću na zapadnoj strani grada
column3: Parents aren’t afraid that someone will beat up their son in a café bar on the West side.

column2: Auta se ne parkiraju po trotoaru na Bulevaru
column3: People don’t park their cars on the sidewalk in Bulevar.

column2: Policija naplati kaznu kad dođe po prijavi, a ne pusti da se vozač samo izvine i ode
column3: A driver has to pay a fine to the police for a driving offense reported by another citizen, he/she cannot just apologize and leave.

column2: Postoji ograda na trotoaru s južne strane kamene zgrade na Bulevaru.
column3: There is a fence on the sidewalk along the south side of the stone building on Bulevar (street).

column2: Vozači poštuju pješačke prelaze u cijelom Mostaru.
column3: Drivers respect pedestrian crosswalks in all of Mostar.

column2: Stubovi od uklonjene ograde nisu ostali oko parka na Bulevaru, kako se neko ne bi povrijedio o njih.
column3: The pillars from the removed fence are not remain around the park in Boulevard, so that no one would get hurt by them.

column2: Oko kontejnera za smeće kod Elektroprivrede nije uvijek neuredno
column3: It’s not always messy around the trash containers near the Electric Power Company.

column2: Građani Bulevara i Cernice mogu prijavljivati probleme svojoj MZ
column3: The citizens of Bulevar and Cernica can report any problem to their local MZ.

column2: Ljudi dobiju odgovor na upite koje su poslali u Gradsku upravu (GU) vezane za infrastrukturne probleme, kao što su kontejneri, svjetlo itd.
column3: The city government answers the questions that people ask about the infrastructure problems such as trash containers, street lights, etc.

column2: Grupa građana koja pokrene inicijativu uređenja plaže Ploča u Cernici dobije podršku od vlasti, a da ne moraju ići privatno kod pojedinca iz vladajuće stranke
column3: A group of citizens who initiate arranging Ploča beach in Cernica receive support from the authorities and don't have to go privately to an individual from the ruling party

column2: Prestupnici se sankcionišu novčano
column3: Criminals are punished with a fine.

column2: Nasilnici se sankcionišu krivično.
column3: Bullies are found guilty and punished.

column2: Kada se dešavaju prekršaji, policija reaguje u skladu sa zakonom
column3: When violations occur, the police react in accordance with the law

column2: Žena iz Cernice radi u Centru 2
column3: A woman from Cernica works in Centar 2.

column2: Pijani prolaznici, koji se ljeti kasno navečer vraćaju, ne deru se u sokaku kod News Bar-a.
column3: A drunk passer-by, who returns late at night in the summer, does not shout in the alley near the News Bar.

column2: Na obalama Neretve nema odbačenih narkomanskih šprica
column3: There aren’t any drug syringes thrown on the shores of the Neretva.

column2: Djeca slobodno silaze na Neretvu bez straha od odbačenih narkomanskih šprica
column3: Children freely climb down to the Neretva river without any fear of discarded drug syringes.

column2: Djeca i mladi osjećaju se sigurno, jer svi zajedno igraju fudbal na istom mjestu na Bulevaru
column3: Both children and adults feel safe because everyone plays football together in the same place in Bulevar.

column2: Policajac, koji obezbjeđuje Skupštinu HNK u Šantićevoj, nije stalno u obližnjoj kladionici Premier
column3: The policemen who stands and guards the parliament of Herzegovina-Neretva Canton isn’t always hanging out in the gambling shop Premier.

column2: Navijači Zrinjskog ne smiju dolaziti na Bulevar, jer petkom i subotom navečer barem 2-3 sata stoji 1 marica, koja sprečava bitke
column3: Zrinjski fans are not allowed to come to Bulevar, because on Friday and Saturday evenings because a police vehicle stands there at least 2-3 hours, which prevents battles

column2: Stanari smiju opomenuti mlađe osobe koje remete javni red i mir bez straha da će im ovi sve porazbijati
column3: The tenants may freely warn young people not to disturb the public order and peace without worrying if someone would break everything (their property).

column2: Ne čuje se galama iz parka kod MZ do 2 ili 3 ujutro
column3: No noise is heard from the park by the MZ until 2 or 3 in the morning

column2: U kasnim satima nije neugodno proći od Bunura prema Cernici, jer ima rasvjete.
column3: It isn't uncomfortable for someone to pass from Bunura to Cernica during the later hours of the night because it is illuminated.

column2: Problem pasa lutalica iza buregdžinice „Rođeni“ je riješen
column3: Behind the Buregdžinica Rođeni the stray dog issue is solved.

column2: U Cernici i Bulevaru nema tenzija i nasilja kada se igraju fudbalske utakmice
column3: During a soccer match, there aren’t any fights or tensions in Cernica and Bulevar.

column2: Ultrasi ne borave u krugu
column3: Ultrasi (Zrinski football fans) don’t hang out in the circle (in Bulevar).

column2: Komšija ne pušta svoje pse bez brnjice da borave u sokacima MZ Cernica dva dana
column3: A neighbor doesn’t let his/her dogs walk freely in the alley without muzzles in Cernica for two days.

column2: Izuzetan dječak iz sokaka nije uvučen u svijet droge
column3: An extraordinary boy from the alley isn’t pulled into the world of narcotics.

column2: Institucije edukuju djecu da droga ne valja (osnovne i srednje škole i policija)
column3: Institutions teach children that narcotics are bad (primary schools, high schools and the police).

column2: Prodavnica na Bulevaru se ne pljačka svako 2-3 mjeseca
column3: The store in Bulevar is not robbed every 2-3 months

column2: Ultrasi ne napadaju u Cernici u ponoć momka koji prolazi tuda
column3: Ultrasi (Zrinski football fans) do not attack a boy in Cernica who’s passing through at midnight.

column2: Djevojku ne izmlate u ponoć pred Rođenim u Cernici jer pokušava da pomogne svom napadnutom prijatelju
column3: A girl doesn’t get beaten up at midnight near Rođeni in Cernica because she tries to help her beat up friend.
